definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: I was gratified at the attendance to my talk, and the enthusiastic response.
sentences.chinese: 聽衆對我的發言予以熱烈的響應，令我深感榮幸。

sentences.english: But such myopia is also deeply regrettable.
sentences.chinese: 但這樣的近視也令人深感遺憾。

sentences.english: I was deeply affected by the news.
We are very proud of our partnership with Huaxin.
sentences.chinese: 與華新的合作伙伴關係使我們深感自豪。

sentences.english: She felt the deepest respect for his skill at dissemBling .
sentences.chinese: 她對他的掩飾技巧深感佩服。

sentences.english: all of people in the office concerned about she ,because no one has seen her lately.
sentences.chinese: 近來誰也不曾見過她，這使辦公室所有同仁深感不安。

sentences.english: I feel deeply honored to be playing against the former Wimbledon Champion.
sentences.chinese: 能與溫布爾登前冠軍球手比賽，我深感榮幸。

sentences.english: Ribble said Louie wasn't just failing, he was suffering.
sentences.chinese: 裏勃說，路易不只是成績跟不上，而且深感學習辛苦。

sentences.english: I'm worried that I will fail in the examination.
sentences.chinese: 這個女孩考試不及格使家長深感憂慮。

sentences.english: I'm terribly sorry for the inconvenience.
sentences.chinese: 對於給您帶來的不便，我深感抱歉。

sentences.english: I'm sorry, for I am deeply sorry that day Shier .
sentences.chinese: 對不起，對於那天的事兒我深感抱歉。

sentences.english: We are all deeply moved by his patriotism .
sentences.chinese: 我們都被他的愛國精神深深感動了。

sentences.english: He have a great feeling of the communion between himself and the hill and lake.
sentences.chinese: 他深感自己與大自然是息息相通的。

sentences.english: We wish to express our deep regret over the passing of your husband.
sentences.chinese: 對你丈夫的不幸逝世我們深感痛惜。

sentences.english: Too ill to get out of bed, she had strong feelings of uselessness.
sentences.chinese: 由於疾病纏身，臥牀不起，她深深感到力不從心。

sentences.english: As a woman I, mysclf know and feel deeply in my heart that success is hard-earned, and it pays to work hard.
sentences.chinese: 作爲一個女人，我深感成功的艱難和付出的艱辛。

definition: to feel even more/to be extremely (sad, lonely, delighted etc)
to feel/to sense/to have the feeling that/to think that/to move/to affect
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
